front.title: Location Hiding: Problem Statement and Requirements

abstract.t: The emergency services architecture developed in the IETF EmergencyContext Resolution with Internet Technology (ECRIT) working groupdescribes an architecture where location information is provided byaccess networks to end points in order to determine the correct dialstring and information to route the call to a Public Safety AnsweringPoint (PSAP). For determining the PSAP Uniform Resource Identifier(URI) the usage of the Location-to-Service Translation (LoST)Protocol is envisioned.This document explores the architectural impact for the IETFemergency services architecture for situations where the InternetAccess Provider (IAP) and/or the Internet Service Provider (ISP) areonly willing to disclose limited or no location information.This document provides a problem statement and lists requirements.
